column1: Strawberry Compote	"Strawberry Compote (клубничный компот) is a chilled sweet drink that is popular in many post-soviet countries. It is similar to strawberry jam or conserves in taste (less sweet/concentrated flavor), but resembles fruit punch in looks and consistency. It is very easy to adjust this recipe and scale it up/down.
column2: FYI, I suggest using organic strawberries for this (may be on the expensive side), it makes a world of difference in flavor."	drinks	medium	2.34	soft drink
column4: russian	Strawberries (two standard packs works best)
column5: Sugar	Get 3 bowls and a butter knife (if the butter knife has a point, that will work better)
column6: Dump out both packs of strawberries into a sieve or bowl and wash them thoroughly.
column7: Remove the stem and leaves/crown of the strawberry. The crown can be peeled by hand, then use the butter knife to cut out the stem.
column8: Large strawberries can be cut in half.
column9: Once all of the strawberries are clean, put them in a standard 4 quart (3.8 L) pot. Fill it with water to the brim.
column10: Put the pot to boil. The strawberries will gradually lose their color, which is completely normal.
column11: Once it boils, let it cook for 5 mins.
column12: After five minutes are over, turn off the heat and incrementally add sugar to your preference. I suggest 1-1.5 cups (237 to 355 grams) of sugar for 4 quarts (3.8 L) of compote. Taste between helpings of sugar to make sure its not oversweetened.
column13: Let the pot cool, then refrigerate. Serve chilled.

column1: Cheddar-Crusted Chicken	Suggested sides: Roasted green beans as well as sweet potatoes mashed with sour cream and butter	main	medium	2.34	chicken
column7: 1 Tbsp Smoked Paprika-Garlic Blend	Combine panko, cheese, and smoked paprika-garlic blend in a shallow dish. Preheat oven to 425F.
column8: Pat chicken dry with paper towel. Carefully slice into the centre of each chicken breast lengthwise and parallel to the cutting board - leaving 1/2 inch intact on the other end. Open up chicken like a book, and season both sides with salt and pepper.
column9: Coat one side of each chicken breast with mayo. Firmly press mayo-coated side into panko mixture to adhere, one at a time.
column10: Transfer chicken to a parchment-lined baking sheet, coated-side up. Bake chicken on the middle oven rack until cooked through (18-20 mins).

column1: Slow-cooked Lamb with Lemon	You’ll need a good-sized lidded pot that can go in the oven for this. But if you don’t have that then you can use a large roasting tray with sides and cover it with foil, sealing it as best you can. It’s an excellent celebration or Sunday meal.	main	hard	3.45	roast
column3: lemon	Lamb shoulder, or something similar, like lamb shank, preferably on the bone. Get something that will fit in your pot, with room for vegetables around it. For example, I usually get half a shoulder, 2 – 3 lbs, 1 – 1.5kg.
column13: fresh bread (optional, to serve)	On the night before: Mix up some olive oil, the juice of half a lemon, the oregano, the rosemary, and some salt and pepper. Rub this mixture into the meat and leave it in the fridge overnight to marinate.
column14: The next day: Heat the oven to 375°F/190°C/gas mark 5.
column15: Break apart the garlic. You can leave the skin on the cloves, or you can peel them, as you prefer. Chop the carrots, leek, onion, the remaining lemon, and the potatoes into chunks.
column16: Arrange the meat in the pot with the vegetables underneath and around it. Pour in any marinating juices, as well as a cup of water.
column17: Cook for 2½ – 3 hours. Half way through it’s a good idea to check and see if it needs some more water to keep things from burning.
column18: Remove the lid and let the meat brown for a few minutes if you think it needs it.
column19: Pull the meat apart and serve, with yoghurt and fresh bread. You can use the juices as a gravy.

column1: Sardine Cakes	Can be served with a Spicy Yogurt Sauce as Tapas or Hors D’Oeuvres.	side	medium	2.34	cake
column8: lemon juice (optional)	"Remove sardines from tin, reserving oil, and place fish in a mixing bowl.
column9: Add remaining fish cake ingredients, along with the oil from one tin (about 2 TB) to the bowl.
column10: Gently mix all the ingredients together with a fork.
column11: Mix until incorporated, but don’t purée.
column12: Use something to scoop the fish cake mix into small balls.
column13: Flatten into small patties 2"" across, and about ½"" thick.
column14: Set patties on a rimmed baking sheet, large cast iron pan, or casserole dish.
column16: While fish cakes chill, mix together all the ingredients for the yogurt sauce.
column17: Move oven rack to the top 3rd of the oven.
column18: Broil for 5 minutes, flip, and broil 3-5 minutes more, until cakes are golden brown.
column19: Drizzle some lemon juice on cakes. Serve while still hot with the yogurt sauce. Enjoy!"
